Calculations time:

345 base ms + 60 ms (from presumed Swifties) = 405 ms
405 ms * 0.99 (Zilean's new maxed-out E) = 400.95
400.95 * 0.3 (Hecarim's max-level passive) = 120.285 bonus AD

And that's just what he'd be getting from this one spell, not to mention anything else, or even the boots he is assumed to have in these calculations.

Nope its an exception just like Thresh box. You can not excede that slow cap unless you have it straight up nice try.

> Additional Information:
Movement speed cannot be reduced below 110, and slows that would reduce it below 220 are modified. To put it another way: a reduction of 99% will not reduce you to 3 movement speed, but rather it will reduce you closer to 110 than a weaker slow would.
Without slow resist from Relentless mastery s3.png Relentless or Boots of Swiftness item.png Boots of Swiftness, your movement speed will be between 110 and 120.

That is from Thresh's wiki page listed as the Additional information for his ult, nice try.
A hard cap on how slow someone can move. Dota Uses it as well, where 100% slows exist, but they don't actually snare the person, simply drop them down to a specific move speed.

That's what I said the first time, that a 99% slow is actually about a 75% because of the cap and the person above me basically told me that wasn't how it worked on abilities like Zil's W and Thresh's R that specifically stated 99%
